settings.title: Who are we?
settings.text: We are Broken River Mining and this is our B2B website.

settings.title: Where are you based?
settings.text: We are boulder opal miners and cutters based in Queensland, Australia. This is the only place in the world where boulder opal is found.

settings.title: What is the difference between this website and your sister site, brokenrivermining.com?
settings.text:
Here we a built a site specifically for jewelry designers and their clients, with prices that are only displayed for our registered jewelers.

At Broken River Mining both our prices and opals are accessible to the public. The boulder opal grades available, and their respective trade prices, range greatly.

settings.title: I am looking for an opal but I don't see it on the website?
settings.text: Let us know. We often have opals that are not listed on the website and may have what you are looking for.

settings.title: Are you prices wholesale or suggested retail?
settings.text: We are a B2B website and our prices are wholesale.

settings.title: Why can I only request availability?
settings.text: We want to save you the disappointment of your selected opal being unavailable. The opal you are looking at could currently be at a trade show. When you request availability, we confirm that your particular opal is immediately available and then contact you to finalize payment and shipping details.Â

settings.title: What kind of payment options do you accept?
May I show videos and photos to a client?
settings.text:
Absolutely! We have both ...

Please don't post them anywhere else though, before checking with us first though

settings.title: Are your photos reliable?
settings.text: Opals are extremely difficult to both photograph and film. We also find the higher the opal grade, the more camera shy they are. That being said, we do not post-edit or manipulate our images. Instead we aim for realistic photos and videos. Therefore our opals will look as are, or even better in real life, than on our website.

settings.title: Column
settings.text: Pair text with an image to focus on your chosen product, collection, or blog post. Add details on availability, style, or even provide a review.

settings.title: How are your opals cut?
settings.text: Our opals are all cut by hand by professional boulder opal cutters. Each opal takes many hours or even days to process from a rough piece of boulder opal to a finished polished opal gemstone.

settings.title: Can you recut an opal for me?
settings.text: No, unfortunately, we can't. There is a lot of risk in the cutting process. It is also time-consuming. We don't want an opal, or a relationship, to be damaged because of an accident during cutting, so we've decided to only cut our own stones.

settings.title: I am a private collector, how can I purchase?
settings.text: Since our site is strictly wholesale, we aren't able to sell to you directly. But we would be more than happy to connect you, so please feel free to get in touch.
